result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anna E. Thomasson

defendant.name: Thomasson, Anna E.
defendant.address: 1928 W College Ave, c/o Pillars, Appleton, WI 54914

records.addlTxt: 9:17 am Defendant Anna E. Thomasson not in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr in court for Anna E. Thomasson.  Attorney Alex Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. No appearance by Defendant - Bench Warrant Authorized effective 12:00 pm on 10/31/2022. If Atty Skorr has contact with the defendant she may reschedule hearing with the judicial assistant. Adj: 9:18 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
and Motion for Pretrial Orders - Atty Kudek

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos (to be completed within 21 days).  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician. Participate in IOP at Options. Meet with Mental Health Provider.

and Motion Hearing. Deft appears while in custody.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court advises Defendant of rights. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for arraignment.  Reading of Information waived - NG pleas entered - PTC date scheduled. Court grants motion to amend bond.
Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
